qas.question: What is the state well known for?
The majority of all households in Himachal own a what?
What is considered pure and used as a ritual cloth?

answers.text: shawls with striking patterns and vibrant colours

qas.question: What are Kangra and Dharamshala famous for?
What is Pashmina well known for?
What product is in demand in Kangra as well as all over the country?
What did ritual cloth in Himchali cause?
What does every household in Dharamshala own?
What is desar considered as when used as ritual cloth?

context: The state is well known for its <a0_0><b5_0>handicrafts<b5_0/><a0_0/>. The carpets, leather works, shawls, metalware, woodwork and paintings are worth appreciating. <b6_0>Pashmina shawls<b6_0/> are a product that is highly in demand in Himachal and all over the country. Himachali caps are famous art work of the people. Extreme cold winters of Himachal <b7_0>necessitated wool weaving<b7_0/>. Nearly every household in Himachal owns <b8_0>a <a1_0>pit-loom<b8_0/><a1_0/>. <a2_0>Wool<a2_0/> is considered as <b9_0>pure<b9_0/> and is used as a ritual cloth. The well-known woven object is the shawl, ranging from fine pashmina to the coarse desar. Kullu is famous for its <a3_0>shawls with striking patterns and vibrant colours<a3_0/>. Kangra and Dharamshala are famous for <a4_0>Kangra miniature paintings<a4_0/>.
